thread.title: Natalie Dormer’s hidden message to school bullies
thread.title_full: Natalie Dormer’s hidden message to school bullies

title: Natalie Dormer’s hidden message to school bullies
text:
Natalie Dormer has hidden a message to her school bullies in Game of Thrones AAP News Corp Australia Network Natalie Dormer has hidden a message to her school bullies in Game of Thrones AAP News Corp Australia Network Taking a stand ... Natalie Dormer is happy with her looks. Picture: Supplied. 
ACTRESS Natalie Dormer was bullied at school for having “pig nostrils”. 
The Game of Thrones star, who plays Margaery Tyrell on the hit fantasy drama, reveals she used to be teased as a child for her appearance, but Natalie has learned to take it all in her stride. Fans have since noted an uncanny similarity between Natalie and The Muppets star Kermit the Frog’s new girlfriend Denise — his rebound after splitting from Miss Piggy — and the familiar looks weren’t lost on the actress, either. School bullies ... Natalie Dormer said she used to be teased for her links but has learnt to take it all in her stride. Picture: Grant Pollard/Invision/AP 
Speaking at New York Comic Con on Thursday, she admitted, “When I saw Kermit’s new girlfriend, I was like ‘Maybe I’m a bit responsible for that’.” 
Natalie has fully embraced her facial features and reveals she even asked Game of Thrones’ writers to include a reference to her nose in a previous episode. Similarities ... Natalie and The Muppets star Kermit the Frog’s new girlfriend Denise seem to have some similarities, something not lost on the actress. Picture: Twitter/ABC 
“There’s a scene in season three where I’m walking on all the cliffs with Sansa, and I’m telling her how I was teased as a young girl for my nose,” Natalie told the crowd. 
“I asked in a dinner with David (Benioff) and Dan (Weiss),‘Please, can you put in a line about a pig nose? I was bullied at school, I used to get told I had pig nostrils.’ I said, ‘For my own demons, it would be sticking two middle fingers up to the bullies of my childhood.’ Other Stories
